On 29 Mar 2018, at 10:10 am, James Croll <JamesCroll@hssaustralia.com.au> wrote:

Hi Nirmala

Can I just check you’ll be joining the presenting team on Sat May 12th?

The Breast Cancer team will be needed from around 8:30am to 11:45am that day.

If so .. could I get a photo of you to include in our marketing of the event

Many thanks

James Croll

HSS

Time

Presenting Doctor(s)

Session

Interactive & Diadactic components

08:15 to 08:45

Breakfast

08:50 to 11:40

Morning tea:

10:10 to 10:35

· Associate Professor Elisabeth Elder

· Dr James French

· Dr Farid Meybodi

· Associate Professor Nirmala Pathmanathan

· Dr Tim Wang

Supported by …

· Rick Kefford (Medical Oncologist)

· Jemma Gilchrist - Psychologist

· Rebecca van Lloy – Psychologist

· Bronwyn Williams (BCN) - Psychologist

Breast Cancer:

Critical issues in the diagnosis, treatment and follow-up of breast cancer

Our morning session will be a comprehensive insight into the critical issues that GP’s need to be aware of when addressing the diagnosis, treatment and follow-up of breast cancer. The session will also focus on the latest research and technology and how this drives individualised treatment.The program will comprise interactive and didactic components which will include presentations, real life case studies and Multi-Disciplinary Team scenarios highlighting the crucial role of each team member, as well as the opportunity to brainstorm so that the participating GP’s can confidently face all the challenges the issue of Breast Cancer brings to their day-to-day practice.

The session will be divided into the following areas:

· Understanding benign breast disease and who to refer on for specialist assessment

· Breast Screening and other Breast Imaging

· Understanding and managing Mastalagia (breast pain)

· Long term follow up of Breast Cancer Patients

· The crucial relationship between the Specialist and the GP

Specialist areas covered will include but not be restricted to:Oncoplastic breast surgery, Breast reconstruction, Skin reducing mastectomy, Medical oncology and surgery.

Didactic component:

Introductory lecturettes will precede and follow each section of the session with the opportunity for Q&A’s. These will comprise one third of the entire session.

Interactive component:

· Two thirds of the session will focus on case studies, specifically benign breast cancer, breast screening plus other imaging for asymptomatic women, and mastalagia. GP’s will break out into small groups to discuss and then present on the subject matter.

· The session will also include a group discussion to clarify the challenges GP’s face on a day to day basis and how these are best resolved.

· The presenting Specialists will then summarise the findings and conclude by clarifying the process as to how best to refer a patient for specialist assessment.

· The interactive component will effectively be a simulated MDT discussion with cases covering aspects of the following topics:

- Essence of diagnostic workup - when to refer to a specialist

- Neoadjuvant Systemic Therapy

- BCS vs Mastectomy

- A basic overview of oncoplastic surgery

- Reconstructive options

- Chemo or not

- Brief overview of anti-HER2 and endocrine therapy options

- Management of common side effects of endocrine therapy

- Modern management of the axilla

- Overview of radiotherapy techniques/side effects

- Common emotional reactions

- Prevention/early detection of lymphoedema

- The role of the breast care nurse


From: Elisabeth Elder [mailto:e.elder@me.com]
Sent: Thursday, 8 March 2018 4:22 PM
To: Jemma Gilchrist <jemgilchrist@gmail.com>
Cc: James Croll <JamesCroll@hssaustralia.com.au>; James French <drjamesfrench@gmail.com>; Rick Kefford <richard.kefford@mq.edu.au>; Farid Meybodi <faridmey@gmail.com>; Jenny Gilchrist <jenny.gilchrist@mq.edu.au>; Tim Wang <Tim.Wang1@health.nsw.gov.au>; Bronwyn Williams <BRONWYN.WILLIAMS@specialistservices.com.au>; Rebecca Van Lloy <rvanlloy@gmail.com>; Brenda Gutierrez <Brenda.Gutierrez@health.nsw.gov.au>; Louise Koelmeyer <louise@therapyforlife.com.au>; Nirmala Pathmanathan <Nirmala.Pathmanathan@health.nsw.gov.au>
Subject: Re: Sponsorship Opportunity: HSS Event - Modern Approaches to Women's Health - Sat May 12th

Hello all

Thanks for your support - that’s really great. Good if we can have the breast cancer seminar first up in the morning so that everyone in the group can attend.

My suggestion would be to run this as a simulated MDT discussion with cases covering aspects of the following topics:

- essence of diagnostic workup - when to refer to a specialist

- neoadjuvant systemic therapy

- BCS vs mastectomy

- basic overview of oncoplastic surgery

- reconstructive options

- chemo or not

- brief overview of anti-HER2 and endocrine therapy options

- management of common side effects of endocrine therapy

- modern management of the axilla

- overview of radiotherapy techniques/side effects

- common emotional reactions

- prevention/early detection of lymphoedema

- the role of the breast care nurse

To make the format more interactive we could have questions for the audience to discuss with each other in groups of 2 or 3 at regular intervals.

Please let me know what you think - happy for any suggestions

Best regards

Elisabeth

On 7 Mar 2018, at 1:20 PM, Jemma Gilchrist <jemgilchrist@gmail.com> wrote:

Hi All,

Yes, very happy to be involved in the MDT presentation. Sorry for the late reply, I had not read the date properly and thought it was this weekend so was tying to problem solve that - relieved that I checked again!

Jemma

On Mon, Mar 5, 2018 at 10:07 AM, James Croll <JamesCroll@hssaustralia.com.au> wrote:

Hi All …

Timing – Yes .. this could initially be the morning session so I’ll aim to provisionally schedule it in then.

Accreditation – And yes, it is to be RACGP accredited and I do have to submit forms and fairly detailed program details to RACGP prior to the event.

I’ll need to establish the structure and content of the program with Elisabeth in the next 7 days or so. Sadly, RACGP ask for everything 2 months prior to the event.

Sponsorship – There are strict RACGP guidelines with regards to they not being present in the room or influencing the content.

However, they will benefit from being able to display during all breaks and lunch.

I’ll liaise with those who’ve mentioned sponsorship .. would be more than happy to talk to them myself

REGARDS

JAMES CROLL

From: Elisabeth Elder [mailto:e.elder@me.com]
Sent: Sunday, 4 March 2018 1:31 PM
To: James French <drjamesfrench@gmail.com>
Cc: Rick Kefford <richard.kefford@mq.edu.au>; James Croll <JamesCroll@hssaustralia.com.au>; Farid Meybodi <faridmey@gmail.com>; Jenny Gilchrist <jenny.gilchrist@mq.edu.au>; Tim Wang <Tim.Wang1@health.nsw.gov.au>; Bronwyn Williams <BRONWYN.WILLIAMS@SPECIALISTSERVICES.COM.AU>; Jemma Gilchrist <jemgilchrist@gmail.com>; Rebecca Van Lloy <rvanlloy@gmail.com>; Brenda Gutierrez <Brenda.Gutierrez@health.nsw.gov.au>; Louise Koelmeyer <louise@therapyforlife.com.au>; Nirmala Pathmanathan <Nirmala.Pathmanathan@health.nsw.gov.au>
Subject: Re: Sponsorship Opportunity: HSS Event - Modern Approaches to Women's Health - Sat May 12th

Hi

Thanks all for your enthusiasm! I agree with you James, that a ‘mock MDT’ - discussion around representative cases may be a good model and we can build in participant interaction in that model. I spoke to James C about creating an event along those lines.

RIck - what’s the Liz Ellis event? Last time the breast section was in the afternoon but as far as I know, the program is not set yet so I suppose we could be first in the morning James C - is that right?

Best regards

Elisabeth

On 4 Mar 2018, at 4:50 AM, James French <drjamesfrench@gmail.com> wrote:

Dear All,

Last time round when we went to do this it became apparent that there were some very strict rules set out by the RACGP which needed to be adhered to for the day to recognised as a CPD eligible event. In essence this meant that the ratio of didactic lectures to audience participation was 10 min : 20min. This I think has some potential difficult limitations, for us if we are to observe this guideline. That said when talking with Trudy who ran the last event, when I brought this up, she commented that I was the only person on the day (we came in late in the day) that had adhered to this, and as far as I know there were no issues with formal recognition. I have not seen any formal feedback though.

James it is my understanding that these events need prior approval from RACGP & this takes quite a lot of work.

All that said I believe we have a great service to showcase & feel confident that it would be of interest to the GP’s and we should not let the prescriptive rules be a deterrent, we may just need to think carefully how we present so as not risking having the session not accredited. I would have thought some form of mock MDT presenting some contrasting / interesting cases to highlight different team members roles / area of interest / areas of interest might be a good place to start with.

regards

James

Jenny and I may be able to rake up some additional Pharma sponsorship if required - e.g. Roche, Novartis, Amgen

I think J&J might be interested in sponsoring.

Regards

Sent from my iPad


On 2 Mar 2018, at 2:55 am, Elisabeth Elder <e.elder@me.com> wrote:

Hi James

Nice to meet with you today. I have copied the whole team into this email - please see below. In essence - James, the new market manager, is planning a GP educational event at HSS on Saturday 12 May. Initially it was going to be quite similar to the event in November last year when James, Farid and I gave individual presentations on benign breast disease, breast pain, follow-up of BC and breast imaging. The other topics on the day were related to gynaecology and plastic surgery. Although this was a popular event, I think it would be great if we could get the opportunity to present our team approach to breast cancer care in a broader perspective as we have discussed before. James seems quite keen on the idea to change the topics of the event and I have suggested we do a team presentation showcasing the breath of services we provide, maybe centred around representative case presentations and providing some key messages to GPs regarding diagnosis, treatment and (shared care) follow up. What do you think? Who would be available?

Best regards

Elisabeth

On 2 Mar 2018, at 5:31 PM, James Croll <JamesCroll@hssaustralia.com.au> wrote:

Hi Elisabeth

Great to catch up. I’ll initially work on the title below but can change this so that it highlights Breast Cancer better.

I’ll be approaching sponsors to sponsor the event. Is there anyone (.. suppliers of importance to you) who you feel it’s worth my approaching and who you’d like to see there?

JAMES

From: James Croll
Sent: Friday, 2 March 2018 5:27 PM
To: 'Monica.Corso@homedoctor.com.au' <Monica.Corso@homedoctor.com.au>
Subject: Sponsorship Opportunity: HSS Event - Modern Approaches to Women's Health - Sat May 12th

Sponsorship Opportunity

Continuing Professional Development Seminar

Modern approaches to Women’s Health

… including critical aspects of Breast Cancer Care &

… innovative techniques in Plastic Surgery

Saturday, 12th May 2018

Hospital for Specialist Surgery

<image005.jpg> <image007.jpg> <image009.png>

Pending 40 Category 1 CPD points to the RACGP QI&CPD Program for 2017-19 Triennium

Sponsorship invitations sent to:

Avant Mutual | Besins Healthcare | Device Technologies | Douglas Hanly Moir | Medtronic | 13SICK

Hi Monica,

I hope you’re well. I wanted to give you the heads up that I’m just finishing off the sponsorship proposal for our next event.

This will be on Saturday May 12th and will focus on Modern Approaches to Women’s Health with a strong focus on Breast Cancer Care and Plastic Surgery.

Once accredited by RACGP, we’ll be marketing the event extensively and expect approx.. 75 GP’s to attend.

I’m going out to the same sponsors who supported our last event and will be offering them the opportunity to sponsor the event at the same rate.

HOWEVER our intention is to ensure that increase the potential reach and put in place disciplines so that you fully engage with the attendees on the day.

Can we speak on Monday to discuss this and other opportunities that we’re planning?

I’d also like to get a handle on whether you’ll be supporting the above.

I’ll call you on Monday. If I miss you, do please try me on 0488 090 904.

Have a great weekend

Warm regards

James Croll

Marketing Manager
